ai.stateMachine

Interface State

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AttackingState, DefendingState, PassiveState, SupportState

    public interface State
    Interface for all agent behavioural states. Agent behavioural states dictate the actions available to a agent, and it's decision making process as to what action is taken. Created by raghavnarula on 05/11/2015.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void enterState(CommandPlayer context)
      Called when a state is entered.
      void exitState(CommandPlayer context)
      Called when a state is exited.
      void processModel(CommandPlayer context, EnvironmentModel model)
      Using the current game state, decide what action to take.
      void updateState(StateMachine stateMachine, EnvironmentModel model)
      Decide if the players behavioural state should change, and if it should, change it.

    • Method Detail

      • enterState

        void enterState(CommandPlayer context)
        Called when a state is entered.
        Parameters:
        context - The agent to which this state applies

      • exitState

        void exitState(CommandPlayer context)
        Called when a state is exited.
        Parameters:
        context - The agent to which this state applies

      • processModel

        void processModel(CommandPlayer context,
                  EnvironmentModel model)
        Using the current game state, decide what action to take.
        Parameters:
        context - The agent to which this state applies
        model - Model containing the current game state.

      • updateState

        void updateState(StateMachine stateMachine,
                 EnvironmentModel model)
        Decide if the players behavioural state should change, and if it should, change it. This decision is based on the current game state.
        Parameters:
        stateMachine - State Machine to update.
        model - Model containing the current game state.
